messages.message:
I just realized this as I was playing around with the Search feature on 'Text' mode for documents in Human Review. It seems to only partially work. It only gives a subset of all the matching keywords when you're searching multiple words at once (example in ss)

cc @Paul H @Serena

i don't understand the issue you're describing

i see that `YTD` and `Gross` are highlighted in your screenshot?
Sorry I should've been more specific— there are two instances of 'YTD Gross' but it's only highlighting one of them
A couple rows below the highlighted row I also see YTD Gross but it's not showing up as a highlighted result
you need to click the down arrow (or press enter) for the second instance to be highlighted
That just takes me to the next page. Here is what it looks like when I select "YTD"

>  A couple rows below the highlighted row I also see YTD Gross but it’s not showing up as a highlighted result
Maybe we’re virtualizing the other pages. If you ctrl + f again, does the second YTD Gross become highlighted?
cc @jack.robbins looping you in to set the priority of the bug when you get the chance!
Will this text view function the same way if we bypass OCR with the new gemini flash accuracy work?
Guessing it will. Seems like it's purely a front end change based on results that have already been extracted. Will let @Paul H weigh in here
Text view will not remain after the new gemini flash since it doesn’t OCR the document
Hmmm- that'll be an interesting side-effect of that project...it is used fairly commonly
I'll reach out to the accuracy team to see if there's some way we can keep it or retain some sort of Search function
